required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of the Drug-drug Interaction Between Ticagrelor and Venlafaxine When Taken Together in Healthy Volunteers
clinical_study.official_title: A Sequential, Open Label Study to Compare the Pharmacokinetics, Safety and Tolerability of Ticagrelor and Venlafaxine Given Concomitantly in Healthy Subjects Aged 18 to 45 Years

brief_summary.textblock: Study evaluates the drug-drug interaction between Ticagrelor and Venlafaxine when taken together in healthy volunteers

primary_outcome.measure: area under the plasma concentration-time curve during a dosing interval (AUCτ) and observed maximum plasma concentration (Cmax)
primary_outcome.description: Venlafaxine and O-desmethylvenlafaxine (ODV) on Day 8 (after multiple dose administration of venlafaxine for 4 days) and Day 9 (after concomitant administration of venlafaxine and ticagrelor):

secondary_outcome.measure: Venlafaxine and ODV on Days 8 and 9: time to Cmax (tmax)
secondary_outcome.description: Ticagrelor and AR-C124910XX on Day 1 (after single dose administration of ticagrelor) and Day 9 (after concomitant administration of venlafaxine and ticagrelor): area under the plasma concentration-time curve from zero to infinity (AUC), Cmax, tmax and apparent terminal half-life t½λz

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety and tolerability of ticagrelor and venlafaxine when given concomitantly by assessments of amount of adverse events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Multiple assessments from day -1 do day 12 and a single assessment at follow up visit.

intervention.description: 90 mg oral immediate release tablets, single dose on days 1 and 9
37.5 mg oral immediate release tablets, administered twice daily on days 4-8

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- a weight of at least 50 kg and a body mass index between 18 to 30 kg/m2
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of clinically significant disease or disorder as judged by the investigator
- Any clinically significant illness, medical/surgical procedure or trauma within 4 weeks of the first administration of drug.
- History of haemophilia, von Willebrand´s disease, lupus anticoagulant or other diseases/syndromes that may alter or increase bleeding.
- History of previous or ongoing psychiatric disease
